text: Killer pies, killer service, can't get enough! Reminds me of growing up in the northern end of Boston!!

This pizza is the best pizza i have had in vegas thus far. I had the white slice and it was so yummy...

A bit pricey but i think that is because it is in a tourist spot. Next to that famous pawn shop. But whatever
 It was amazing NY style pizza. And staff was really tentative and nice.
The food and customer service are great, but the price is salty. I could had bought 3 large  pizzas at Pizza Hut for what I paid there.
Excellent service! I'm glad I tried this place out. The veggie pizza and cannoli is really good

I have worked in downtown Las Vegas for a long time and it's great to see all the amazing food popping up down here. But just found my new favorite pizza joint. Inna gadda di pizza is authentic New York style pizza and is very delicious. Love how fast it is to come here on my lunch break and they have great service!
Holy canoli !!! Best pizza in the area, super inexpensive, large slices, friendly staff, outdoor seating , clean, AND old fashion sodas

The most subpar pizza shop in Vegas. It's not awful by it isn't good either it is just there. It is over priced and ali who made our pizza didn't listen to our order and had it ready 20 min before our scheduled pick up. I guess he was just trying to get out of work early because our scheduled pick up was 20 min before close. Needless to say the pizza was cold when we arrived. I'll stick to my regular pizza place because this was just a fail.

Best pizza in Vegas!! Authentic, NY pizza and the staff is great! Pizza is amazing! Make it a stop when you visit across the parking lot to "Pawn Stars"! HAD TO COME EDIT THIS REVIEW to add that they have THE BEST canollis I've ever eaten ! Omg! I LIVE in NY and have had many a cannoli, seriously, the best filling EVER!
Then go upstairs and visit the Rockabilly store ladies!

Simply the one of the best pizza places in Vegas.  We visited there during our stay last week of 2015.  My favorite was their The Blanco.  The pizza looked simple but it's got layers of flavors.  The ingredients compliment one another perfectly.  

I also loved the cannoli which was made just right not too sweet as cannoli from other places tend to be. Another must try when you visit Inna Gadda Di Pizza.

We were visiting Vegas and looking for something off the Strip. We turned to Yelp and found this great little place. Its in a little brightly color plaza next to the "Pawn Stars" store. The slices were very large and reasonably priced. I got the White pizza and it was delicious. My bf got the pepperoni and he enjoyed it as well. We were talking the very friendly women working there (from Phoenix) and we mentioned that we had found this restaurant on Yelp. While we were sitting outside eating our pizza (and Poutine from next door), she came out with free cannoli's for us since they were giving them out for checking in on Yelp!. We would definitely go again!
Very delicious!  The crust is amazing and everything is fresh.  I'll definitely be making a habit of their pizza.
What a kick ass pizza!! New York pizza has arrived to Vegas! Incredible flavors ! Boylan Soda served as well! A must stop in when your downtown! Took a pie home just because ! Lol
I frequent this place -  BEST white pizza I've ever had. And their meatballs? Sooooo good! Seriously a must try.
Some awesome New York style pizza over here!They've got the perfect crust recipe that's hard to find.

You can't beat the price, service, and taste of this little pizza joint. Definitely worth the little trek off the strip to enjoy a slice of pie. We got the all meat and bianco specialty pies and both were delicious. If you're a fan of secret pizza at the cosmo, I recommend giving this place a shot. It does not disappoint! Plus, you can also check out other tasty places in the Pawn Plaza like Pawn Donut & Coffee and a little bbq joint (the name escapes my mind right now haha).
Can't say enough about how good the slices are.  They roast the veggies first and the crust is crispy.  Plus they were super nice folks.

I work a block up from this wonderfully delicious jewel of a place! The pawn plaza has been a wonderful addition  to the south end of the strip. I love that I can walk a short distance and get some fresh air while getting a yummy Stromboli! Vanessa is super sweet and the staff are all friendly!
This is great tasting pizza. I'm from the eastcoast and I'm glad to find a pizza spot that reminds me of back home. Super friendly staff! I'll def be back for more!

Inna Gadda di Pizza is Vegas' hidden gem! Some of the best pizza I've had in awhile. I recommend the Bianco with the bomb Ricotta cheese on top and for those really hungry grab the All Meat pie. Something so unique about this place was the cane sugar sodas...such a big hit!!! 

Super friendly staff too!

Delicious Pizza!
I ordered the white pizza with pesto, sun-dried tomatoes, and pepperoni. 
It's so good! 
Be sure to try the black cherry soda made with cane sugar! It's so tasty!!
Best pizza in Vegas! We sat at the bar upstairs and they delivered! Friendly nice and we got free cannoli's!!

My wife and j were so thankful we found this place. Excellent food and customer service! The prices were extremely reasonable and the owner cares so much that he'll come out and talk to you, to make sure everything's tasting good. I had the all meat pizza with meatball, sausage and pepperoni and it was delicious! Wife had the cheese....you can't go wrong here!

I hit a few pizza places while visiting Las Vegas.  Inna Gadda di Pizza was my favorite.  The crust was perfect and crisp and the pie itself was really great. The cannoli was really fresh and yummy but, really small and; that was the only downfall.  We were greeted with enthusiasm and we had a great conversation with the gentleman who was working.  I would highly recommend this pie to anyone.

Decent pizza place located in the downstairs back left corner or Pawn Plaza. I brought yelpers Rohlin and Laina here and we were supposed to go to Secret Pizza as well Inna Gadda di Pizza however we decided on just this place instead. Turns out that the people who opened Inna Gadda di Pizza are also the creators of Secret Pizza at the Cosmo. I will tell you one thing the lines here are much smaller than at SP! For now anyway.....

I guess there was some sort of mess up with our pizza while cooking. A worker told us that it didn't cook right so they brought us a free sausage calzone while they made another pizza. Nice touch and much appreciate the honestly. The sausage calzone was very good and something I'd order on another visit. It was liked by others at my table as well and I think we all wanted a bit more. Next time! They do have Boylan cane soda and refills are free. I liked my soda but found nothing that special about it and prefer Coke with real sugar. Just my own preference really.

My wife ordered a White Slice that she requested be double cut so we could split with each other just to see what theirs tasted like here and it was like a delicious garlicky cheese bread. We had a pizza called All Meat Pizza that had meatballs, sausage, and pepperoni on it. The crust was thin and cooked nicely. I like that it didn't seem overly saucy. My wife and I usually don't agree on pizza but we both enjoyed everything we ate here and Rohlin and Laina said they liked it and were impressed too. They also gave us a free cannoli with yelp check in and I gave mine away so I don't know what it tasted like but it's worth mentioning that they have a check in offer. My suggestion is to come down and try this place while it's still low-key before everyone else finds out about it and before they start charging Secret Pizza prices.
Best pizza we've ever had!!!! So fresh and so yummy!! Very friendly staff too!  Definitely a must when you're in town.
If you like that good wood fired crust taste this is one of the best. It's available by the slice and so good!! Fresh, hot and tasty. Customer service is also great. Located in the new Pawn Plaza.
Wonderful friendly service with amazing authentic New York style pizza.. Very hard to find here in Vegas. I'm a New Yorker and this is real NY pizza!
The service was great, Ali was super nice and friendly, the pizza was yummy, fast and affordable, and the soda machine has the best stuff in it. Thank you Ali!

White pizza, $3.50 by the slice and incredible: mozzarella, garlic cream, dollops of ricotta, house-smoked tomatoes, and a drizzle of pesto. Definitely going to add artichokes or anchovies next time!

Space is small with pizzas on display ready to toss in the oven. Shakers of oregano, parm, and red pepper flakes available on your way out, covered outdoor patio seating available. 

Service was super friendly. Despite being a bustling area, it was a quick stop to grab a slice at a good price. Bonus points for the "real talk" at the bottom of the menu: NO RANCH DRESSING!
Super nice staff.  Excellent pizza.   Great tables in an outdoor patio overlooking the pawn stars shop.  Very reasonable pricing!  Cool place!

The team was amazing to work with in taking care of our employee party. The food was amazing, some of the best pizza I have had in town, especially the white pizza. Highly recommend for a party or for dining out. Plus the garlic knots are addicting!

Whoop whoop! What a great place for pizza lovers! Very small, but soooo cool, with lots of different choices, from slices to different crusts and toppings, with a real Italian style (and huge portions)! The patio is very welcoming, facing the TV-famous Pawn shop, where you can sit and enjoy your freshly-baked pizza, or just take it to-go. Fast and reliable service, customer-oriented. Ciao!!

Very happy this place opened near me! I can just walk over, grab a slice & make it back in time before tv commercials end. :) 
Picked up a pepperoni slice and that was delicious! Checked in on Yelp & got a free cannoli; which was delightful.
Staff was very kind, informative & friendly! I will definitely be back.

We were looking for something other than the usual dominos, pizza hunt, papa john's, etc.  This pizza did not disappoint. The pizza pie is huge,  I love the thin crust, and they put just the right amount of cheese.  I will definitely order again when in town.
Best Pizza in Vegas!!!  Can't wait to go back!!!  Please open a spot in LA it's much needed
Super friendly staff, delicious pies, yummy sodas, and tasty cannolis.  What more could you ask for?  Glad we made the stop on our way thru town.

Was in the area looking for something to bring back to out hotel and found this gem on YELP. Ali greeted my sister and I and was friendly and funny. We ordered 1 pie, half cheese and half pepperoni and meat ball. The pizza was great! My picky toddlers ate it with no complaints- I think because the pizza wasn't saucy or sour. The crust was delicious, not thick or bready like places and the slices were huge! Overall, I'd be back again when I'm in the area, great price for what you get... wish they had pineapple though! It's my fave! Thanks again, Ali, for making a great pizza!

This place is located in pawn star plaza . Very good New York style pizza. The staff is very friendly. Luckily my office is behind it. There are many pizza choices in Las Vegas and this is by far the best in downtown area.

Loved the pizza. Real NY style pizza. Very tasty, and only $3 a slice.  Similar pizza on the strip was $6 to $7 a slice, and looked old and dried out. 

I also love the fact that they have a pure cane sugar soda fountain machine with natural sodas.  The Black Cherry was so good! 

I will definitely stop in when I'm in Las Vegas again!
I'm a big fan of NYC pizza. Ordered a large cheese pie and could barely make it through a slice. After spending $20, I had to go right back out and buy a new dinner.
Really good pizza and the service was great Ali was the guy serving us and definitely made us feel welcome for sure I would definitely come back

Staying at the Downtown Grand, after a long travel day to Vegas, wanted some comfort food to enjoy in the room. Utilized the Eat24 app with the help of Yelp recommendations. Ordered a cheese pie and cannoli. Arrived to the hotel within an hour, piping hot with all the garnishments and even plates. Extremely friendly delivery lady, great pie, superb cannoli and they even threw in a tiramisu. Highly recommend....A+++++++

Inna Gadda di Pizza is located downstairs in Pawn Plaza. Hubby and I first came here for lunch with Cali yelpers Rohlin and Laina A. and we all really liked our pizza and stromboli. There is a yelp check in offer for a free cannoli and all four of us had no problem redeeming it. We enjoyed our first visit enough to bring New Jersey yelper, Tony J. and he's originally from Brooklyn, so he wasn't against a few tasty slices for dinner. There isn't any seating or tables inside. You place your order inside for pizza by the slice or you can order a whole specialty pie from the menu or choose your own toppings. They also offer salad, stromboli, calzones and have a few dessert items on the menu. The prices are very fair for Downtown and I really hope they stay the way they are. Slices range from $3 - $3.50 and a cheese pizza is $18 which can easily feed 4 people. I'd recommend having a fresh pie made and eating it when it comes out of the oven instead of taking it home to have the best experience. The couple slices I had leftover later on when I got home were good, but I enjoyed it fresh from the oven much better. Besides, pizza is better when it's shared around a table with good company! They have heat lamps above most of the tables at Pawn Plaza that put off a decent amount of heat which is nice during the cooler months.

They have bottled water an Boylan products at the (free refills) fountain. The Boylan products are made with cane sugar and if you are a fan of Birch Beer, they have that. I tried the black cherry during both visits and wasn't that crazy about it. I found it personally to be lacking in flavor and fizz and would have preferred an ice cold coca cola.

White Slice ($3.50) - mozzarella, garlic cream, house-smoked tomatoes, dollops of ricotta and a pesto drizzle. This was a last minute add-on. Laina and I were both looking at the white slices they had displayed for sale and just kind of looked at each other and said "I want to try that" so with no hesitation we were both hollering at my hubby who was at the register to add a slice of the white to try. I asked if they would mind double-cutting the slice since we'd be sharing it to sample and it wasn't an issue. We ended up sharing the slice with our husbands and we all really liked it. I'd have no problem coming back and ordering a whole one!

Sausage Stromboli ($6) - This was brought to our table complimentary by one of the guys working because he said there was a problem with the way our pizza cooked and he wanted to make a fresh one so we had a pizza that was the way it should be. Wow that was nice! The stromboli was 4 pieces and I'm usually not a sausage fan, but really liked this! It would make a nice meal on its own or is perfect as an appetizer.  

All Meat Pizza ($23.25) - This pizza has pepperoni, sausage and meatball on it. The pizza was a good size as were the slices. I liked the thin crust, taste of the sauce and the amount of cheese. The toppings could have been put on a little more even, but they didn't skimp on the amount used. We were all full and satisfied,  

Pepperoni Pizza ($19.75) - There was a good amount of pepperoni and cheese. A good thin crust and big slices. The pizza here is "fold and eat" all the way for me, but they do have utensils inside if you prefer to eat your pizza that way. They also have cheese, crushed red peppers and napkins that you can bring to your table, just be courteous and return what you take back inside when your are done. 

Cannoli ($3) - On my first, us four yelpers got ours free with the yelp check-in offer. I found the shell to be a bit hard and the filling had a nice citrus flavor, but was also a stiff and not creamy. The next visit when the yelper I was with redeemed his check-in offer the guy working asked about hubby and I, so I mentioned that we had already used ours on a previous visit. He said to give them to us anyway, very nice! This time the shell was the right crispness and the filling was creamy and had just the right amount of citrus flavor. 

The employees working on both visits were really friendly and helpful. They came outside and checked on our table making sure we enjoyed our food and to see if we needed anything. I don't make a point to go Downtown too often anymore, but will make the effort to stop by here again in the future for date nights with hubby and when I have friends or family in town.
I will definitely be back! Food was great service was on point 5 stars all the way around. I can't wait for the our next business meeting here! :)))))))

Absolutely love the name, the people we met working there, the service, and most importantly the food. We had multiple slices of pizza, garlic knots, and cannoli and all were outstanding but garlic knots were to die for. I might have had a foodgasm

Yummy.  Had a slice of the meat pizza and garlic knots.  Knots were super yummy... as was pizza.  :)

Working downtown, I will be back.

In what seems to be a lifeless plaza lies a hidden gem. Tucked back in the corner of the plaza on the first floor, this lice shop offers some tasty pizza. I was looking for the white pizza I have seen pictures of but there was none made. They offered to make one but I was fine with trying the meat pizza. Pepperoni, sausage and meatball with cheese and sauce and some thin yet tasty dough. It's definitely a slice worth trying if your in the area.
With a Yelp check in you get a free cannoli. I took advantage of this and glad I did. What seems to be a tiny treat is packed with big flavors. A citrus filled cream is piped into the shell when you order and are a perfect bite after a delicious slice

This new yelp 5-star rated place is located in the new Pawn Plaza adjacent to the TV famous Gold & Silver Pawn Shop. Local Yelpers Christie L. and Marc S. drove me here, because I was staying at the MGM Grand on the strip. He got a parking spot closest to the pizza place.  

We decided to order a freshly made New York style Pepperoni pizza, which we would share and eat outside in the Pawn Plaza under heat lamps, which were very effective on this 50 degree evening. There is no seating inside the pizza place, When I checked in on Yelp I received a coupon for a single complimentary cannoli. The manager/chef knew we were all yelpers so he decided to give us three complimentary cannoli's for my one coupon. That was very nice of him. He mentioned his owner was also from N.Y. I was really surprised how tasty the pizza was as well as the cannoli. Marc rated the place 4 stars. I agree with Marc in rating the place at least 4 stars or possibly 4.x, but, not 5 stars.

I look forward to returning again in April to enjoy another pizza with Christie L. and Marc S.
Very good white pizza, birch beer and a canolli with a delightful citrus filling. I would absolutely come back for a bite
All meat is delicious! One pie fed 4 and we still have 2 slices left. All white pizza is one of a kind. If you love thin crust InnaGadda is the place to go!
The pizza is amazing! The guys from NY and I had many pizzas in NY but this one by far one of the best. Located next to Pawn Shop. Worth a visit and a quick bite.

I'm a HUGE fan of NYC style pizza.  When I saw Rohlin A.'s review that this place was the sister location to Secret Pizza at the Cosmopolitan without the markup, I had to try when I was in town.  So I dragged my poor boyfriend to Inna Gadda di Pizza early in the morning.  We arrived before they opened so we went to the World Famous Gold & Silver Pawn shop a la Pawn Stars fame next door to kill some time.  

Once we walked back to the pizza place, we were the first customers and ordered a slice of pepperoni ($3.50), a slice of white pizza ($3.50) and 2 Boylan natural cane sugar sodas ($2.50 ea.) from the fountain.  With Yelp check-in, we received free cannoli which are filled to order.  We grabbed our sodas at the fountain, then sat down at the bar stools inside to wait for them to heat the slices in the oven.  The pizzas were ready quickly and we dug in.  It was perfectly crisp on the bottom with oozy cheese.  I eat my giant slices folded so that I get crispy bites from the top and bottom without burning my mouth with the molten cheese.  The white pizza slice was as good as I remembered with that hit of garlic.  It was so good, we ordered two more slices: a pepperoni for me and an all meat slice ($4.50) for him.  

The lemon zest cannoli was the perfect size too.  It was crispy on the outside and paired well with the soft, creamy filling.  It reminded me of the cannoli I had in Rome.  I had the cherry cola soda which was really good too.  Service was excellent.  Both of the guys behind the counter were really friendly and asked we were locals or from out of town.  I wish I didn't live so far away!  If you're looking for a cheap but delicious and satisfying lunch, Inna Gadda di Pizza should be on your radar.

If I have ever ordered a pizza in this town before and given it a 5 Star review, may I be horsewhipped! 

This place makes the BEST sausage, pepperoni, mushroom, extra cheese pizza I have ever had outside of New York City and this particular ingredient combination here can stand up to any pizza, anywhere! 

(I've tried other combinations here with mixed results, but they nail the one above every time. Note: The extra cheese request is VERY important because they are light on the cheese as a rule.) 

PLUS THEY DELIVER! 

ps. My friend just informed me that they have a sister restaurant in the Cosmopolitan, which serves the same pizza, but at a HUGE premium. I feel like I have a locals secret here!!

Tip: The service and delivery are phenomenal and don't forget to order their wonderful tiramisu if you have a craving for dessert! Yum!

Just ok pizza. The soda selections seemed pretty good.

We got a drooping pizza where the crust is just too soft and everything droops and you are forced to eat with a fork/knife. Not a knock, but expected more from such a well rated pizza joint. Nothing blew my mind about our pie but it was a good belly-filler. 

Their $7 veggie salad was super overpriced but I got it since I was needing my veggie fix. Also, nothing extraordinary.

As far as I'm concerned this is one of the best kept pizza secrets in town and also one of the best values for the area.

I almost overlooked this spot since pizza seemed like a possible waste of food crawl space, but then figured why not. I am so glad that we stopped here. We split a slice of Pepperoni Pizza and a Pepperoni Stromboli. The pizza was thin and crispy with great flavor. The Pepperoni Stromboli was amazing. The bread had a great flavor and literally the perfect amount of crisp I can imagine. There was a slight crisp on the outside and then the bread was flaky and delicious inside. The inside was loaded with pepperoni and mozzarella. Absolutely up there with the best Stromboli I've ever had from a pizza spot. 

Inna Gadda di Pizza will be the reason I return to the Pawn Plaza in the future.

Hands down the best pizza I have had in Las Vegas!  Upon walking in my friends and I were greeted by Vanessa. She not only greeted us warmly but was quick to offer suggestions based off of what we were craving at the moment.  Everything from the pepperoni and cheese pie were INCREDIBLE!  You can't beat great food and wonderful service!  Highly recommend and will be back ASAP.

Ps.  Do NOT leave without trying one of their desserts!  Simply a-m-a-z-i-n-g!
Very good pizza. Nice and crispy. Great flavor. Wonderful service. They made us feel very welcomed. We will be back.

This was our last meal in Las Vegas and we were introduced to this pizza joint by local Yelpers extraordinaire Christie L. and Marc S. and they graciously picked up the bill as well (greatly appreciated)!  The original plan was to do a pizza crawl from Secret Pizza at the Cosmopolitan and ending at Inna Gadda.  After discovering the same people had opened both places, we opted to skip Secret Pizza (the more expensive location) and grab a good-bye Vegas lunch at Inna Gadda.

The claim to fame for this area is the proximity to World Famous Gold & Silver Pawn Shop which is the focal point of the History Channel's Pawn Stars.  There was literally a line of people wrapping around the building just to get in and meet the workers.  Inna Gadda is located ( http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/inna-gadda-di-pizza-las-vegas-2?select=MDEN4DqdbIvsQlXfSFgFHQ ) next door in Pawn Plaza on the lower level at the end furthest from the street.

We arrived pretty early in the day, but there were already plenty of pies available if you wanted to order by the slice:

( http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/inna-gadda-di-pizza-las-vegas-2?select=UjTpmB3e3-_i42IkcloWAw )

( http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/inna-gadda-di-pizza-las-vegas-2?select=4cdPvdVDfrIAUY2klXNTYA )

The menu ( http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/inna-gadda-di-pizza-las-vegas-2?select=NYWmEUP4HuiA18efZcfzEA ) is pretty simple with one size of pie, pizza by the slice, a decent amount of toppings, four specialty pizzas, calzone, stromboli, two types of salad, pure cane soda fountain ( http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/inna-gadda-di-pizza-las-vegas-2?select=w-YFLcCIhjzZq4avEHbh0w ) and desserts.  There is an offer for a free cannoli ( http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/inna-gadda-di-pizza-las-vegas-2?select=PCnr9afYUdZUywv5b9mVgA ) with your Yelp check in.

In addition to the cannolis, we ordered an All Meat Pizza ( http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/inna-gadda-di-pizza-las-vegas-2?select=QLAyt6o0rmPEu6o5Lq82xA ) and a slice of White Pizza ( http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/inna-gadda-di-pizza-las-vegas-2?select=YEjP8Y9GbfiNCGdemTyDsg ) to split between the four of us.  A few of us also sampled the Boylan Pure Sugar Sodas and I believe the consensus was these sodas were okay, however I thoroughly enjoyed the black cherry version.

Seating is very limited with just a couple of tables outside in the plaza area and I don't recall any seating inside the restaurant.  This leads me to believe most of the orders are of the to-go variety.

While we were waiting for our pizza, the manager came out with a free sausage stromboli ( http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/inna-gadda-di-pizza-las-vegas-2?select=gXakCJSeCo_jOeK28HoVyg ) because our initial pizza didn't cook right (the oven was on strike) and the pizza had to be re-fired.  

Rohlinism:  If your oven is killing the business, try killing the customers with kindness!

The manager also threw in an extra cannoli with our free ones with check in.  The re-fire didn't take that long and we had the stromboli and slice of white pizza to keep us company while we waited.

The sauce and crust were very good and my only real complaint would be the toppings were a little uneven on the pizza.  The price is a little on the higher side, but the quality of pepperoni, meatballs and sausage was very good.  The better half is a "cheese fiend" and I heard no complaints about a lack of cheese on the pizza.  There doesn't seem to be any savings ordering a specialty pizza as opposed to ordering a cheese pizza and adding toppings.  The white pizza had a very good flavor and was particularly pronounced in the garlic department (love that garlic breath!) and the stromboli was a hit with the group as well.  The cannolis were decent and there was a lemon zest added to the mascarpone, but the pastry dough was a little over fried for my taste.  Not something I would order if I was paying $3.00 a pop, but they make a really good check in offer!

The staff and manager were very friendly and attentive during our visit.  The manager and one of the workers came out a few times to make sure we were enjoying our pizza and stromboli.

This location is more downtown and off the strip, but it is worth seeking out and they have some interesting artwork in the center too, sorry about the lack of photographic evidence to support my assertion!
Delicious great classic New York style pizza, spoke to the owners and all their ingredients are home made. Glad they deliver!!!
Friendly people serving up mind-blowing good pizza. Two tiny counters inside- the rest of the seating is out on the patio. This is legit- and a welcome break from the craziness of the strip. Do it!
Ali is the man! Pizza and cannoli on point!! The place is friendly and good vibes. Small but the pizza is big!

Stopped in last night and tried the Bianco and the Sunday Gravy...both kicked serious ass!! The meatballs on the Sunday Gravy are homemade and I could tell. So good. Obviously these guys know what they're doing. If you want amazing pizza in the Pawn Stars (Gold & Silver Pawn) area, go down to Pawn Plaza and check this place out! I need to try the cannoli next time!

I got off the Deuce at Charleston and walked over....looking for a storefront as I've never been here before....kept walking...saw the pawn store with a huge lineup outside..Apparently Chumlee was in the building.. But I was not here to see that... And kept walking....hmmm..where the heck is this place...turned back and walked back south....past the pawn shop...stopped a block away..hmmm...nope..back north... There is a complex right beside the pawn shop...could it be in here? Success!
Hopefully the walking around in 40c degree weather was worth it. 
Ordered the white pizza slice and the stromboli and got the free cannoli. Never had one before.Cannoli was amazing. Like a crunchy cheese cake.
The food was Amazing too as was the service.
Totally worth it.

Items Ordered:
Tomato Pie with Pepperoni
White Pie with Artichoke Hearts
Cannoli
Tiramisu
Black and White Cookie

Located in the increasingly busy Pawn Plaza, but still more of a 'secret' than the unnamed space owned by the same group at The Cosmopolitan, Inna Godda di Pizza occupies the downstairs corner pocket furthest from The Strip and featuring similar pies to those that have impressed both critics as well as the late night Marquee crowd ever since opening a visit to the month old space was every bit as good as the original, even an early morning oven malfunction not preventing a pair of freshly made pies from shining.

Not remotely a New Yorker, nor one to romanticize late nights slurping a soggy "99cent slice," it was with the same standards and biases as always that I entered Inna Gadda di Pizza, and although Foghat played in place of expected Iron Butterfly while the owner explained that an overnight oven shutdown had delayed the day's preparations it was with a little patience and conversation that minutes passed, each dough rolled out and hand stretched before careful topping, the $3 Red and $3.50 White by-the-slice options quickly sold to a steady stream of traffic, the vast majority visiting from out of town.

Proudly touting the use of ingredients that justify paying a few cents more per bite, suffice it to say that compared to "Secret Pizza" the prices trend a bit lower at the new location, and with a nice char imparted to the crust by "about ten minutes at five-fifty" both the bright and zingy red sauce beneath melted Mozz and garlic cream with dollops of ricotta plus house-smoked tomatoes were on par with the best in the genre, the fifty-cent toppings and absolute steal for a handful of marinated artichoke hearts while pepperoni was a touch oily and less well-spiced than expected.

Surprisingly offering three desserts, all made n house and ranging $2-$4 each, anyone filling cannoli to-order deserves support and taking the time to match crisp shells to sweet cheese tinged in citrus the two-bite pastries were delightfully light yet extremely flavorful, a spot less less praise offered for a small bowl of tiramisu that seemed a bit too soggy at its base despite generous coffee notes while the seemingly out-of-place Black & White was smaller than most, yet moist and fluffy enough that you may want two.

****About as good as it gets for a "slice shop" particularly on Las Vegas Boulevard for less than $4, Inna Gadda di Pizza is only likely to get better with time and seasoning of the ovens, a few small tweaks potentially capable of making this the first "must-visit" spot at Pawn Plaza for locals as well as tourists.

My name is Latoya and I am addicted to Inna Gadda di Pizza's cannolis. Now that I got that off my chest, here's my review:

When you are dining on a budget in downtown Las Vegas, Inna Gaddda di Pizza is the perfect place. You can feast on pizza, a cannoli and a soft drink for only seven bucks. 

Seating is very limited, a few bar stools inside and a couple of tables outside.
Their staff is extremely personable!

For Vegas standards, their pizza is quite tasty and the price is just right.

Great tasting and really authentic New York Style pizza! And they have original sodas along with some yummy Ginger Ale and Birch Beer which is a very yummy root beer soda. Very pleasant staff and upbeat attitudes.

I looooooove this place !!' My family and I were here some months ago for the first time and we loved it so much all we could think of eating while in Vegas is Pizza !!! Such a great manager and I love the energy she gives when we walk in !!! I can finally say that we have a Pizza Spot in Vegas !! It might be a 4 hour drive but it's so worth it !!! Thank you !!!
One of the better pizza places in town....thin and crispy east coast style pizza, and delicious stromboli.

What happened here? Stopped by today for a slice with high hopes - and given its pedigree, why wouldn't I? Secret Pizza at The Cosmopolitan is rightly a Vegas institution, and Those Guys Pies in the Lakes is my pick for the very best pizza in Vegas. But the pepperoni slice served here was disappointing. The crust felt flat, stiff, almost crackery, in comparison to the rich and doughy texture of the Those Guys crust. I contemplated tossing my crust away unfinished - a canary in the coal mine when it comes to pizza. Nothing special. I won't be back.

I don't usually write reviews but just had to. Easy parking, yummy pizza, smooth flavorful cannolis and great service! Just wish they had indoor seating but at least there are heaters and plenty of seating. Reasonable price too. We got a large with 8 slices (we cut it into 16) and two sodas and the 6 of us were stuffed on $30.  We paid more than that for one person's buffet yesterday and not sure we got the same reaction. I wouldn't do the drinks again but I'm not a drink person. Seems just ordinary. I've had my share of authentic NY pizza and this is up on my top 5. We got a pesto, onion, tomato veggie pizza and wasn't sure if it would be bland but it was so flavorful! Soft chewy crust, not too much sauce or cheese. A very very tasty slice in my opinion and I will be coming back again and avoiding the crowds and lines on the strip for an authentic NY slice.

From the creator of secret pizza at the Cosmo,  they have this cute little pizza store. It's located in the plaza next to the famous pawn shop. I know the famous one is the white pie pizza with ricotta cheese, pesto, and oven dried tomatoes. My classic favorite though is the pepperoni pizza.  I definitely recommend this pizza joint. Bonus - natural soda fountain drinks....delicious I had to try them all and the black cherry was my winner.
As a New Yorker living in Las Vegas I must say this is THE REAL DEAL!!! Delicious crispy thin cheesy HOT slice!!! The black cherry soda just paired this slice perfectly.  Great customer service.

Service was friendly, restaurant was clean.  Soda selection was excellent.  Boylan is my favorite brand of soda.  We ordered 4 slices of pizza and 2 pepperoni, 1 three meat and 1 white.  The white was the best one, the pesto drizzle sets it off in my opinion.  It was delicious.
